content:
The given ERD does not show any normalization techniques applied to it. Normalization is a process of organizing data in a database to reduce redundancy and dependency. It involves breaking down larger tables into smaller tables and establishing relationships between them.

However, based on the structure of the ERD, it seems to follow some normalization rules such as each table having a unique identifier, and the relationships between the entities are properly defined. For example, the Customer table has a unique identifier (customer\_id) and the Account table has a foreign key (customer\_id) to establish the relationship between them. Similarly, the Transaction table has a foreign key (account\_number) to connect it to the Account table.

Overall, the ERD seems to be well-structured and organized, but without seeing the specific steps taken to normalize the data, it cannot be confirmed if it is normalized.
